articles.author: Deutsche Welle
articles.title: Ukraine updates: F-16 training begins in Poland, EU says - DW (English)
articles.description: The European Union's foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said that training for Ukrainian pilots had already begun in Poland and some other countries, after the United States gave its green light. DW has the latest.
articles.content:
The training of Ukrainian pilots to fly F-16 jets has begun in Poland, EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said on Tuesday.
The move comes after US President Joe Biden last week gave the go-ahead … [+11470 chars]

articles.title: Infosys unveils AI-first offering Topaz, sees huge interest from clients - Moneycontrol
articles.description: Infosys’ efforts in AI come a time when technology demand is slowing down in its major markets such as the US and Europe.
articles.content: Software major Infosys on May 23 unveiled Topaz, a new offering that combines data analytics, artificial intelligence, and generative AI, signifying the growing importance of this fast-evolving techn… [+6211 chars]

articles.author: Victoria Allen
articles.title: Women are TWICE as likely to die after a heart attack, study finds - Daily Mail
articles.description: The results, presented at Heart Failure 2023, which is a scientific congress of the European Society of Cardiology, showed women were almost 2.8 times more likely to die within 30 days.
articles.content:
Women are more than twice as likely to die after a heart attack compared to men, a study suggests.
More than 30,000 women a year in the UK are admitted to hospital after having a heart attack.
Now … [+5700 chars]
